name: Chromecast
description: Chromecast was a line of digital media players that allowed users to play online content on a television.
shutdownReasonDetail: Streaming device for casting content to TVs became obsolete as smart TVs integrated casting natively

name: VPN by Google One
description: VPN by Google One was a virtual private network service that provided users encrypted transit of their data and network activity and allowed them to mask their IP address.
shutdownReasonDetail: VPN service bundled with Google One storage plans discontinued due to unsustainable cost structure

name: YouTube Stories
description: YouTube Stories (originally YouTube Reels) allowed creators to post temporary videos that would expire after seven days.
shutdownReasonDetail: Short-form vertical video feature shut down as it couldn't compete with TikTok and Instagram Reels

name: Google Album Archive
description: Google Album Archive was a platform that allowed users to access and manage their archived photos and videos from various Google services, such as Hangouts and Picasa Web Albums.
shutdownReasonDetail: Photo storage and organization service retired as Google Photos became the primary solution

name: Google Domains
description: Google Domains was a domain name registrar operated by Google.
shutdownReasonDetail: Domain registration service sold to Squarespace, likely due to low margins and competitive market

name: Jacquard
description: Jacquard was a small tag to make it easier and more intuitive for people to interact with technology in their everyday lives, without having to constantly pull out their devices or touch screens.
shutdownReasonDetail: Smart clothing technology using conductive fabric threads failed to gain mainstream adoption

name: Google Surveys
description: Google Surveys was a business product by Google aimed at facilitating customized market research.
shutdownReasonDetail: Survey and market research platform discontinued due to declining advertiser interest

name: Google Code Competitions
description: Google Code Jam, Kick Start, and Hash Code were competitive programming competitions open to programmers around the world.
shutdownReasonDetail: Competitive programming challenges platform retired as third-party alternatives dominated

name: Google Stadia
description: Google Stadia was a cloud gaming service combining a WiFi gaming controller and allowed users to stream gameplay through web browsers, TV, mobile apps, and Chromecast.
shutdownReasonDetail: Cloud gaming service shut down after failing to attract enough users and developers

name: Google Duo
description: Google Duo was a video calling app that allowed people to call someone from their contact list.
shutdownReasonDetail: Video calling app merged with Google Meet after overlapping functionality caused confusion

name: Android Auto for phone screens
description: Android Auto for phone screens was an app that allowed the screen of the phone to be used as an Android Auto interface while driving, intended for vehicles that did not have a compatible screen built in.
shutdownReasonDetail: Standalone phone screen projection discontinued as Android Auto was integrated into phone OS

name: Google My Business (app)
description: Google My Business was an app that allowed businesses to manage their Google Maps Business profiles.
shutdownReasonDetail: Mobile app for business management consolidated into web-only experience

name: Cameos on Google
description: Cameos on Google allowed celebrities and other public figures to record video responses to the most common questions asked about them which would be shown to users in Google Search results.
shutdownReasonDetail: Feature allowing celebrities to answer Google searches directly saw minimal engagement

name: YouTube Go
description: YouTube Go was an app aimed at making YouTube easier to access on mobile devices in emerging markets through special features like downloading video on wifi for viewing later.
shutdownReasonDetail: Lightweight YouTube app for emerging markets no longer needed as data became more affordable

name: Google Contributor
description: Google Contributor was a program run by Google that allowed users in the Google Network of content sites to view the websites without any advertisements that are administered, sorted, and maintained by Google.
shutdownReasonDetail: Ad-supported micropayment platform failed to attract sufficient publisher participation

name: Google Maps Coordinate
description: Google Maps Coordinate was a service for managing mobile workforces with the help of mobile apps and a web-based dashboard.
shutdownReasonDetail: Field service coordination tool discontinued due to limited enterprise adoption

name: Fitbit Coach
description: Fitbit Coach (formerly Fitstar) was a video-based bodyweight workout app that used AI to personalize workouts based on user feedback.
shutdownReasonDetail: Fitness coaching app shut down after Fitbit acquisition as Google consolidated fitness offerings

name: Fitstar Yoga
description: Fitstar Yoga was a video-based yoga app that created unique yoga sessions based on user preference and skill level.
shutdownReasonDetail: Yoga instruction app retired following Fitbit acquisition to streamline product portfolio

name: Google OnHub
description: Google OnHub was a series of residential wireless routers manufactured by Asus and TP-Link that were powered by Google software, managed by Google apps, and offered enhanced special features like Google Assistant.
shutdownReasonDetail: WiFi router discontinued as mesh networking market became too competitive

name: Chatbase
description: Analytics platform for Google's Dialogflow chatbot & others, started by the Google-funded Area120 incubator then retired and partially merged into Dialogflow itself.
shutdownReasonDetail: Chatbot analytics platform shut down after acquisition by Google and migration to other tools

name: DropCam
description: Dropcam was a line of Wi-Fi video streaming cameras acquired by Google in 2014.
shutdownReasonDetail: Smart security camera brand absorbed into Nest product line after acquisition

name: Google Toolbar
description: Google Toolbar was a web browser toolbar that provided a search box in web browsers like Internet Explorer and Firefox.
shutdownReasonDetail: Browser toolbar became unnecessary as modern browsers integrated similar functionality natively

name: Google My Maps
description: My Maps was an Android application that enabled users to create custom maps for personal use or sharing on their mobile device.
shutdownReasonDetail: Map creation and sharing tool lost relevance as Google Maps added custom map features

name: Zync Render
description: Zync render was a cloud render platform for animation and visual effects.
shutdownReasonDetail: Cloud rendering service shut down after acquisition as Google Cloud offered alternative solutions

name: Google Commerce Search
description: Google Commerce Search was an enterprise search service that powered online retail stores and e-commerce websites that improved speed and accuracy.
shutdownReasonDetail: E-commerce search API discontinued due to low adoption and preference for standard search

name: Google Shopping Mobile App
description: The Google Shopping Mobile App, which had absorbed Google Express when it launched, provided a native shopping experience with a personalized homepage for mobile users. It is now retired and the functionality lives on in the Shopping Tab.
shutdownReasonDetail: Dedicated shopping app retired as mobile web and main Google app provided better shopping experience

name: Google Play Movies & TV
description: Google Play Movies & TV, originally Google TV, was an app used to view purchased and rented media and was ultimately replaced with YouTube.
shutdownReasonDetail: Movie and TV purchasing/rental service shut down as streaming services dominated the market

name: Google Public Alerts
description: Google Public Alerts was an online notification service owned by Google.org that sends safety alerts to various countries.
shutdownReasonDetail: Emergency and disaster alert system discontinued as alerts were integrated into Search and Maps

name: Google Go Links
description: (also known as Google Short Links) was a URL shortening service. It also supported custom domain for customers of Google Workspace (formerly G Suite (formerly Google Apps)).
shutdownReasonDetail: Internal URL shortening service shut down due to security concerns and lack of proper governance

name: Tilt Brush
description: Tilt Brush was a room-scale 3D-painting virtual-reality application available from Google, originally developed by Skillman & Hackett.
shutdownReasonDetail: VR painting application faced strong competition from other creative VR tools

name: Android Things
description: Android Things was an Android-based embedded operating system (originally named Brillo) aimed to run on Internet of Things (IoT) devices.
shutdownReasonDetail: IoT platform for smart devices discontinued after failing to achieve critical mass of developers

name: YouTube VR (SteamVR)
description: YouTube VR allowed you to easily find and watch 360 videos and virtual reality content with SteamVR-compatible headsets.
shutdownReasonDetail: VR video viewing app for Steam shut down as YouTube VR on other platforms was sufficient

name: Measure
description: Measure allowed users to take measurements of everyday objects with their device's camera utilizing ARCore technology.
shutdownReasonDetail: AR measuring app made obsolete by native measurement tools built into iOS and Android

name: Google Crisis Map
description: Google Crisis Map was a website that allowed to create, publish, and share maps by combining layers from anywhere on the web.
shutdownReasonDetail: Disaster mapping tool shut down as crisis information was integrated into Maps and Search

name: Pigeon Transit
description: Pigeon Transit was a transit app that used crowdsourced information about delays, crowded trains, escalator outages, live entertainment, dirty or unsafe conditions.
shutdownReasonDetail: Transit directions feature in Google Maps prematurely killed before reaching wide availability

name: Enhanced 404 Pages
description: Enhanced 404 Pages was a JavaScript library that added suggested URLs and a search box to a website's 404 Not Found page.
shutdownReasonDetail: Service providing custom error pages discontinued due to minimal usage and maintenance burden

name: YouTube Streams
description: YouTube Streams allowed users to watch a YouTube video together while chatting about the video in real-time.
shutdownReasonDetail: Live streaming feature in YouTube app replaced by standard YouTube Live functionality

name: Password Checkup extension
description: Password Checkup provided a warning to users if they were using a username and password combination checked against over 4 billion credentials that Google knew to be unsafe.
shutdownReasonDetail: Browser extension merged into Chrome's native password manager functionality

name: Google Photos Print
description: Google Photos Print was a subscription service that automatically selected the best ten photos from the last thirty days which were mailed to user's homes.
shutdownReasonDetail: Physical photo printing service shut down due to unprofitable business model and low demand

name: Google Play Music
description: Google Play Music was a music and podcast streaming service, and online music locker.
shutdownReasonDetail: Music streaming service shut down in favor of YouTube Music as Google's unified music platform

name: Shoelace
description: Shoelace was an app used to find group activities with others who share your interests.
shutdownReasonDetail: Social event planning app failed to gain traction against established competitors like Meetup

name: Neighbourly
description: Neighbourly was a mobile app designed to help you learn about your neighborhood by asking other residents, and find out about local services and facilities in your area from people who live around you.
shutdownReasonDetail: Hyperlocal Q&A app discontinued after low adoption outside of India launch markets

name: Material Theme Editor
description: Material Theme Editor was a plugin for Sketch App which allowed you to create a material-based design system for your app.
shutdownReasonDetail: Design tool for Material Design themes shut down as Material Design evolved and tooling changed

name: Google Station
description: Google Station was a service that gave partners an easy set of tools to roll out Wi-Fi hotspots in public places. Google Station provided software and guidance on hardware to turn fiber connections into fast, reliable, and safe Wi-Fi zones.
shutdownReasonDetail: Public WiFi service in emerging markets shut down due to unsustainable operational costs

name: One Today
description: One Today was an app that allowed users to donate $1 to different organizations and discover how their donation would be used.
shutdownReasonDetail: Charitable donation app discontinued due to low user engagement and donation volumes

name: App Maker
description: App Maker was a tool that allowed its users to build and deploy custom business apps easily and securely on the web without writing much code.
shutdownReasonDetail: No-code app development platform shut down due to limited capabilities and enterprise adoption

name: SoundStage
description: SoundStage was a virtual reality music sandbox built specifically for room-scale VR.
shutdownReasonDetail: VR music creation app discontinued as Google exited consumer VR content creation

name: Google Cloud Print
description: Google Cloud Print allowed users to 'print from anywhere;' to print from web, desktop, or mobile to any Google Cloud Print-connected printer.
shutdownReasonDetail: Wireless printing service discontinued as native OS printing and direct WiFi printing improved

name: Google Spotlight Stories
description: Google Spotlight Stories was an app and content studio project which created immersive stories for mobile and VR.
shutdownReasonDetail: VR storytelling app discontinued as Google shifted away from consumer VR content production

name: Datally
description: Datally (formerly Triangle) was a smart app by Google that helped you save, manage, and share your mobile data.
shutdownReasonDetail: Data management app discontinued as Google Files and other competitors offered better functionality

name: Google Specialized Search
description: Google Specialized Search allowed users to search across a limited index of the web for specialized topics like Linux, Microsoft, and 'Uncle Sam.'
shutdownReasonDetail: Vertical search engines for specific topics shut down due to lack of sustainable revenue model

name: Google Clips
description: Google Clips was a miniature clip-on camera that could automatically capture interesting or relevant video clips determined by machine learning algorithms.
shutdownReasonDetail: AI-powered camera for capturing moments automatically failed due to privacy concerns and limited utility

name: Google Daydream
description: Google Daydream was a virtual reality platform and set of hardware devices that worked with certain Android phones.
shutdownReasonDetail: VR platform discontinued after failing to compete with Oculus and other established VR ecosystems

name: Google Bulletin
description: Google Bulletin was a hyperlocal news service where users could post news from their neighborhood and allow others in the same areas to hear those stories.
shutdownReasonDetail: Hyperlocal news app shut down as it couldn't compete against established local news platforms

name: Touring Bird
description: Touring Bird was an Area 120 incubator project which helped users compare prices, book tours, tickets, and experiences, and learn about top destinations around the world.
shutdownReasonDetail: Travel planning app discontinued due to insufficient user adoption and market saturation

name: YouTube Leanback
description: YouTube Leanback was an optimized version of YouTube used for television web browsers and WebView application wrappers.
shutdownReasonDetail: TV-optimized YouTube interface replaced by native smart TV apps and improved TV experiences

name: YouTube for Nintendo 3DS
description: YouTube for Nintendo 3DS allowed users to stream YouTube videos on the portable gaming console.
shutdownReasonDetail: YouTube app for 3DS shut down as mobile gaming shifted away from dedicated handheld consoles

name: Hire by Google
description: Google Hire was an applicant tracking system to help small to medium businesses distribute jobs, identify and attract candidates, build strong relationships with candidates, and efficiently manage the interview process.
shutdownReasonDetail: Recruiting and job search platform discontinued after Google couldn't compete with LinkedIn and Indeed

name: Google Correlate
description: Google Correlate was a service that provided users information about how strongly the frequency of multiple search terms correlates with each other over a specified time interval.
shutdownReasonDetail: Tool for finding correlations in Google search data retired due to minimal academic and business usage

name: YouTube Messages
description: YouTube Messages was a direct messaging feature that allowed users to share and discuss videos one-on-one and in groups on YouTube.
shutdownReasonDetail: Direct messaging feature in YouTube removed as users preferred other messaging platforms

name: Follow Your World
description: Follow Your World allowed users to register points of interest on Google Maps and receive email updates whenever the imagery was updated.
shutdownReasonDetail: Tool for tracking geographic changes in satellite imagery discontinued due to limited user interest

name: Blog Compass
description: Blog Compass was a blog management tool that integrated with WordPress and Blogger available only in India.
shutdownReasonDetail: Blog analysis tool shut down as the blogging ecosystem matured and alternatives emerged

name: Google Radio Automation
description: Google Radio Automation was a hardware and software service used by radio operators to automate song playing among other radio station functions.
shutdownReasonDetail: Radio automation software for broadcasters sold off as Google exited the traditional radio business

name: Google Cardboard
description: Google Cardboard was a low-cost, virtual reality (VR) platform named after its folded cardboard viewer into which a smartphone was inserted.
shutdownReasonDetail: Budget VR headset discontinued as standalone VR headsets like Oculus Quest became affordable

name: YouTube Video Editor
description: YouTube Video Editor was a web-based tool for editing, merging, and adding special effects to video content.
shutdownReasonDetail: Basic video editing tool removed as YouTube Studio and third-party editors provided better features

name: Revolv
description: Revolv was a monitoring and control system that allowed users to control their connected devices from a single hub.
shutdownReasonDetail: Smart home hub bricked after Google acquisition, causing significant customer backlash

name: Chromecast Audio
description: Chromecast Audio was a device that allowed users to stream audio from any device to any speaker with an audio input.
shutdownReasonDetail: Audio-only Chromecast discontinued as smart speakers with casting became more popular

name: Google Allo
description: Google Allo was an instant messaging mobile app for Android, iOS, and Web with special features like a virtual assistant and encrypted mode.
shutdownReasonDetail: Messaging app shut down after failing to gain traction against WhatsApp, Messenger, and iMessage

name: CallJoy
description: CallJoy was an Area 120 project that provided phone automation for small-to-medium businesses allowing them to train the bot agent with responses to common customer questions.
shutdownReasonDetail: AI phone assistant for small businesses acquired and shut down with minimal integration into Google

name: Google Blog Search API
description: Google Blog Search API was a way to search blogs utilizing Google.
shutdownReasonDetail: API for searching blogs discontinued as Google shifted away from specialized search services

name: Google Real-Time Search
description: Google Real-Time Search provided live search results from Twitter, Facebook, and news websites.
shutdownReasonDetail: Real-time search results removed after Twitter deal ended and social media indexing became complex

name: Inbox by Gmail
description: Inbox by Gmail aimed to improve email through several key features.
shutdownReasonDetail: Alternative Gmail interface shut down as its best features were integrated into standard Gmail

name: Sparrow
description: Sparrow was an email client for OS X and iOS. Google acquired and then killed it.
shutdownReasonDetail: Email client acquired by Google and shut down to eliminate competition for Gmail

name: Google Answers
description: Google Answers was an online knowledge market.
shutdownReasonDetail: Q&A service where experts answered questions for payment failed to compete with free alternatives

name: Google Deskbar
description: Google Deskbar was a small inset window on the Windows toolbar and allowed users to perform searches without leaving the desktop.
shutdownReasonDetail: Desktop search toolbar discontinued as Windows integrated similar search functionality natively

name: Writely
description: Writely was a Web-based word processor.
shutdownReasonDetail: Word processor acquired by Google that became the foundation for Google Docs

name: Google Click-to-Call
description: Google Click-to-Call allowed a user to speak directly over the phone to businesses found in search results.
shutdownReasonDetail: Click-to-call button for AdWords ads discontinued as mobile calling became ubiquitous

name: Google Reader
description: Google Reader was an RSS/Atom feed aggregator.
shutdownReasonDetail: RSS feed reader shut down despite vocal user base as Google shifted focus to social feeds

name: Google Wave
description: Google Wave was an online communication and collaborative real-time editor tool.
shutdownReasonDetail: Real-time collaborative platform shut down after users found it too complex and confusing

name: Google Notebook
description: Google Notebook allowed users to save and organize clips of information while conducting research online.
shutdownReasonDetail: Note-taking tool discontinued as Google Keep launched as a simpler, mobile-first alternative

name: Web Hosting in Google Drive
description: Web hosting in Google Drive allowed users to publish live websites by uploading HTML, CSS, and other files.
shutdownReasonDetail: Service allowing personal websites hosted on Google Drive shut down due to abuse concerns

name: Encrypted Search
description: Encrypted Search provided users with anonymous internet searching.
shutdownReasonDetail: HTTPS version of Google Search made default, making separate encrypted search unnecessary

name: Google Goggles
description: Google Goggles was used for searches based on pictures taken by handheld devices.
shutdownReasonDetail: Visual search app using phone camera discontinued as Google Lens offered superior AR capabilities

name: iGoogle
description: iGoogle was a customizable Ajax-based start page or personal web portal.
shutdownReasonDetail: Personalized homepage discontinued as users shifted to mobile devices and social media feeds

name: Google Spaces
description: Google Spaces was an app for group discussions and messaging.
shutdownReasonDetail: Group sharing app shut down after failing to differentiate from established collaboration tools

name: Google Map Maker
description: Google Map Maker was a mapping and map editing service where users were able to draw features directly onto a map.
shutdownReasonDetail: Crowdsourced map editing tool shut down after being integrated directly into Google Maps

name: Trendalyzer
description: Trendalyzer was a data trend viewing platform.
shutdownReasonDetail: Data visualization tool acquired from Gapminder integrated into Google's analytics products

name: Picasa
description: Picasa was an image organizer and image viewer for organizing and editing digital photos.
shutdownReasonDetail: Photo management software discontinued as Google Photos became the unified solution

name: Google Code
description: Google Code was a service that provided revision control, an issue tracker, and a wiki for code documentation.
shutdownReasonDetail: Open-source project hosting shut down as GitHub and GitLab dominated the developer community

name: Google Swiffy
description: Google Swiffy was a web-based tool that converted SWF files to HTML5.
shutdownReasonDetail: Flash-to-HTML5 conversion tool discontinued as Flash became obsolete industry-wide

name: Panoramio
description: Panoramio was a geo-location tagging and photo sharing product.
shutdownReasonDetail: Photo-sharing service shut down after acquisition as Google Photos became the primary platform

name: Google Helpouts
description: Google Helpouts was an online collaboration service where users could share their expertise through live video.
shutdownReasonDetail: Video chat service for getting expert advice failed due to poor unit economics and limited adoption

name: Google Moderator
description: Google Moderator was a service that used crowdsourcing to rank user-submitted questions, suggestions, and ideas.
shutdownReasonDetail: Tool for creating polls and Q&A sessions discontinued after integration into Google Forms

name: Google Questions and Answers
description: Google Questions and Answers was a free knowledge market that allowed users to collaboratively find answers to their questions.
shutdownReasonDetail: Q&A feature in Google Maps shut down as reviews and ratings proved more useful for users

name: Orkut
description: Orkut was a social network designed to help users meet new and old friends and maintain existing relationships.
shutdownReasonDetail: Social network shut down after failing to compete against Facebook in emerging markets like Brazil

name: Quickoffice
description: Quickoffice was a productivity suite for mobile devices which allowed the viewing, creating and editing of documents, presentations and spreadsheets.
shutdownReasonDetail: Mobile office suite discontinued after its features were fully integrated into Google Docs, Sheets, and Slides

name: Google Notifier
description: Google Notifier alerted users to new emails on their Gmail account.
shutdownReasonDetail: Desktop notification tool made obsolete by native OS notification systems and Chrome notifications

name: Meebo
description: Meebo was a browser-based instant messaging application which supported multiple IM services.
shutdownReasonDetail: Social network acquired by Google and shut down to eliminate competition for Google+

name: Google Chart API
description: Google Chart API was an interactive Web service that created graphical charts from user-supplied data.
shutdownReasonDetail: API for generating charts and graphs retired in favor of modern JavaScript visualization libraries

name: Google Mini
description: Google Mini was a smaller version of the Google Search Appliance.
shutdownReasonDetail: Physical search appliance for small businesses discontinued after cloud search became dominant

name: Google Search Appliance
description: Google Search Appliance was a rack-mounted device that provided document indexing functionality.
shutdownReasonDetail: Enterprise search appliance discontinued as cloud-based search solutions became more cost-effective

name: Google URL Shortener
description: Google URL Shortener, also known as goo.gl, was a URL shortening service.
shutdownReasonDetail: Link shortening service shut down due to security concerns and the proliferation of alternatives like Bitly

name: Google Buzz
description: Google Buzz was a social networking, microblogging and messaging tool that integrated with Gmail.
shutdownReasonDetail: Social networking layer built into Gmail failed to gain adoption and faced privacy backlash

name: Google Desktop
description: Google Desktop allowed local searches of a user's emails, computer files, music, photos, chats and Web pages viewed.
shutdownReasonDetail: Desktop search and indexing tool discontinued as operating systems improved native search capabilities

name: Google Chrome Apps
description: Google Chrome Apps were hosted or packaged web applications that ran on the Google Chrome browser.
shutdownReasonDetail: Desktop applications for Chrome discontinued in favor of Progressive Web Apps and web-based solutions

name: Google Public Service Search
description: Google Public Service Search provided governmental, non-profit and academic organizational search results without ads.
shutdownReasonDetail: Search engine for government and university websites shut down due to insufficient demand

name: Google Video Marketplace
description: Google Video Marketplace was a service that included a store where videos could be bought and rented.
shutdownReasonDetail: Video rental and purchase service shut down as streaming services dominated the market

name: Google Browser Sync
description: Google Browser Sync was a Firefox extension that synced information like passwords and browsing history.
shutdownReasonDetail: Browser extension for syncing settings across devices made obsolete by Chrome's native sync feature

name: Google Lively
description: Google Lively was a web-based virtual environment that provided a new way to access information.
shutdownReasonDetail: 3D avatar-based virtual world shut down after failing to attract users beyond initial curiosity

name: Hello
description: Hello was a service by Picasa that let users share pictures "like you're sitting side-by-side."
shutdownReasonDetail: Photo sharing and blogging tool integrated into Blogger and Picasa after early success

name: SearchMash
description: SearchMash was an experimental, non-branded search engine that Google used to be able to play around with new search technologies, concepts, and interfaces.
shutdownReasonDetail: Experimental search interface testing new features shut down after successful concepts were integrated

name: Dodgeball
description: Dodgeball was a location-based social network where users texted their location to the service, and it notified them of friends and points of interest nearby.
shutdownReasonDetail: Location-based social network acquired by Google and later shut down after failing to compete with Foursquare

name: Google Mashup Editor
description: Google Mashup Editor was an online web mashup creation service with publishing, syntax highlighting, and debugging.
shutdownReasonDetail: Tool for creating web mashups discontinued as modern web development frameworks made it obsolete

name: Google Ride Finder
description: Google Ride Finder was a service that used GPS data to pinpoint and map the location of taxis, limos, and shuttle vehicles available for hire in 10 U.S. metro areas.
shutdownReasonDetail: Real-time car service locator shut down as Uber and Lyft partnerships made it redundant

name: Google Health
description: Google Health was a personal health information centralization service that provided users a merged health record from multiple sources.
shutdownReasonDetail: Personal health record platform shut down due to privacy concerns and limited patient adoption

name: Postini
description: Postini was an e-mail, Web security, and archiving service that filtered e-mail spam and malware (before it was delivered to a client's mail server), e-mail archiving.
shutdownReasonDetail: Email security and archiving service shut down after acquisition as features were integrated into Gmail

name: Marratech e-meetings
description: Marratech was a Swedish company that made software for e-meetings (e.g., web conferencing, videoconferencing).
shutdownReasonDetail: Video conferencing tool shut down after acquisition as Google focused on Meet and Hangouts

name: Google SearchWiki
description: SearchWiki was a Google Search feature which allowed logged-in users to annotate and re-order search results.
shutdownReasonDetail: Feature allowing users to edit and annotate search results discontinued due to spam and abuse

name: GOOG-411
description: GOOG-411 (or Google Voice Local Search) was a telephone service that provided a speech-recognition-based business directory search.
shutdownReasonDetail: Free 411 directory service shut down as smartphones made directory assistance obsolete

name: Tour Builder
description: Tour Builder allowed users to create and share interactive tours inside Google Earth with photos and videos of locations.
shutdownReasonDetail: Tool for creating geographic tours in Google Earth shut down as Google Earth evolved

name: Google Base
description: Google Base was a database provided by Google into which any user can add almost any type of content, such as text, images, and structured information.
shutdownReasonDetail: Structured data submission service discontinued as search algorithms became better at extracting data

name: Google Labs
description: Google Labs was a technology playground used by Google to demonstrate and test new projects.
shutdownReasonDetail: Internal incubator for experimental products shut down as Google restructured its innovation process

name: Google PowerMeter
description: Google PowerMeter was a software project of Google's philanthropic arm that helped consumers track their home electricity usage.
shutdownReasonDetail: Home energy monitoring tool shut down after utility partnerships failed and smart home market evolved

name: Google+
description: Google+ was an Internet-based social network.
shutdownReasonDetail: Social network shut down after failing to compete with Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram despite major investment

name: Google Schemer
description: Google Schemer was a Google service for sharing and discovering things to do.
shutdownReasonDetail: To-do list and activity planning app shut down after failing to gain sufficient user engagement

name: Google Latitude
description: Google Latitude was a location-aware feature of Google Maps, a successor to an earlier SMS-based service Dodgeball.
shutdownReasonDetail: Location sharing and check-in service shut down as Google+ and Maps integrated similar features

name: Picnik
description: Picnik was an online photo editing service that allowed users to edit, style, crop, and resize images.
shutdownReasonDetail: Photo editing web app shut down after acquisition as Google+ Photos integrated editing features

name: Google Showtimes
description: Google Showtimes was a standalone movie search result page.
shutdownReasonDetail: Movie showtime search feature consolidated into standard Google Search results

name: Bump!
description: Bump! was an iOS and Android mobile app that enabled smartphone users to transfer contact information, photos, and files between devices.
shutdownReasonDetail: Contact and file sharing app using phone bump gesture shut down after acquisition by Google

name: Google Nexus
description: Google Nexus was Google's line of flagship Android phones, tablets, and accessories.
shutdownReasonDetail: Google-branded Android devices discontinued in favor of the Pixel brand and partnership models

name: Jaiku
description: Jaiku was a social networking, micro-blogging and lifestreaming service comparable to Twitter.
shutdownReasonDetail: Microblogging and social networking service shut down after acquisition by Google

name: Knol
description: Knol was a Google project that aimed to include user-written articles on a range of topics.
shutdownReasonDetail: User-generated encyclopedia competing with Wikipedia shut down due to quality control issues and lack of adoption

name: Google Play Edition
description: Google Play Edition devices were a series of Android smartphones and tablets sold by Google.
shutdownReasonDetail: Android devices with stock Google software discontinued as manufacturers preferred custom skins

name: Google Compare
description: Google Compare allowed consumers to compare several offers ranging from insurance, mortgage, and credit cards.
shutdownReasonDetail: Insurance and financial comparison service shut down due to regulatory complexity and competition

name: Gizmo5
description: Gizmo5 was a VOIP communications network and a proprietary freeware soft phone for that network.
shutdownReasonDetail: VoIP service shut down after acquisition as Google Voice became the primary telephony product

name: Google Code Search
description: Google Code Search was a free beta product which allowed users to search for open-source code on the Internet.
shutdownReasonDetail: Search engine for searching within source code shut down as GitHub and specialized tools dominated

name: SlickLogin
description: SlickLogin was an Israeli start-up company which developed sound-based password alternatives, was acquired by Google and hasn't released anything since.
shutdownReasonDetail: Authentication method using sound waves shut down after acquisition with minimal integration

name: Google Page Creator
description: Google Page Creator was a website creation and hosting service that allowed users to build basic websites with no HTML knowledge.
shutdownReasonDetail: Drag-and-drop website creation tool shut down as Google Sites launched with better capabilities

name: Project Tango
description: Project Tango was an API for augmented reality apps that was killed and replaced by ARCore.
shutdownReasonDetail: Augmented reality platform for spatial computing shut down as Google shifted AR focus to ARCore

name: Fabric
description: Fabric was a platform that helped mobile teams build better apps, understand their users, and grow their business.
shutdownReasonDetail: Mobile development platform shut down after acquisition by Google from Twitter

name: Nexus Q
description: Nexus Q was a digital media player that allowed users with Android devices to stream content from supported services to a connected television or speakers via an integrated amplifier.
shutdownReasonDetail: Spherical media streaming device discontinued after poor reception and limited content ecosystem

name: Google Catalogs
description: Google Catalogs was a shopping application that delivered the virtual catalogs of large retailers to users.
shutdownReasonDetail: Digital catalog browsing app shut down as retailers shifted to web and app-based catalogs

name: Google Hotpot
description: Google Hotpot was a local recommendation engine that allowed people to rate restaurants, hotels, etc. and share them with friends.
shutdownReasonDetail: Local recommendation feature integrated into Google+ shut down when Google+ was discontinued

name: Google Sidewiki
description: Google Sidewiki was a browser sidebar tool that allowed users to contribute information to any web page.
shutdownReasonDetail: Browser sidebar for adding comments to web pages shut down due to spam and limited adoption

name: AdSense for Feeds
description: AdSense for Feeds was an RSS-based service for AdSense that allowed publishers to advertise on their RSS Feeds.
shutdownReasonDetail: Ad service for RSS feeds shut down as feed readership declined and monetization proved difficult

name: Aardvark
description: Aardvark was a social search service that connected users live with friends or friends-of-friends who were able to answer their questions.
shutdownReasonDetail: Social search engine allowing users to ask questions shut down after acquisition due to quality issues

name: Google Shared Stuff
description: Google Shared Stuff was a web page sharing system that allowed users to bookmark pages and share them.
shutdownReasonDetail: Service for sharing links and content shut down as Google+ and Reader offered similar features

name: Zeitgeist
description: Google Zeitgeist was a weekly, monthly, and yearly snapshot in time of what people were searching for on Google all over the world.
shutdownReasonDetail: Annual search trend report discontinued as Google Trends website made data continuously available

name: Project Ara
description: Project Ara was a modular smartphone project under development by Google.
shutdownReasonDetail: Modular smartphone project canceled due to technical challenges and market viability concerns

name: Google Talk
description: Often remembered as 'Gchat', Google Talk was a messaging service for both text and voice using XMPP.
shutdownReasonDetail: Instant messaging service discontinued as Google consolidated messaging efforts into Hangouts and later Chat

name: BebaPay
description: BebaPay was a form of electronic ticketing platform in Nairobi, Kenya that was developed by Google in partnership with Equity Bank.
shutdownReasonDetail: Mobile payment service shut down after failing to compete in crowded payment market

name: Google Fast Flip
description: Google Fast Flip was an online news aggregator, something of a high tech microfiche.
shutdownReasonDetail: News browsing interface mimicking magazine page-turning shut down due to lack of user engagement

name: Google Web Accelerator
description: Google Web Accelerator was a client-side software that increased the load speed of web pages.
shutdownReasonDetail: Performance acceleration tool discontinued as broadband speeds improved and browser optimization advanced

name: Reply
description: Reply was a mobile app that let users insert Smart Replies (pre-defined replies) into conversations on messaging apps.
shutdownReasonDetail: Smart email reply app shut down after acquisition and integration into Gmail's Smart Reply feature

name: Google Squared
description: Google Squared was an information extraction and relationship extraction product that compiled structured data into a spreadsheet-like format.
shutdownReasonDetail: Structured search engine attempting to organize web data into tables failed due to technical limitations

name: Google Glass Explorer Edition
description: Google Glass Explorer Edition was a wearable computer with an optical head-mounted display and camera that allows the wearer to interact with various applications and the Internet via natural language voice commands.
shutdownReasonDetail: Smart glasses developer edition discontinued after privacy concerns and limited enterprise use cases

name: BufferBox
description: BufferBox was a Canadian startup that provided consumers 24/7 convenience of picking up their online purchases.
shutdownReasonDetail: Package delivery locker service shut down after acquisition by Google with minimal integration

name: Grand Central
description: Grand Central was a Voice over IP service that was acquired by Google, and turned into Google Voice.
shutdownReasonDetail: VoIP service acquired by Google that became the foundation for Google Voice

name: Nexus Player
description: Nexus Player was a digital media player that allowed users to play music, watch video originating from Internet services or a local network, and play games.
shutdownReasonDetail: Android TV streaming device discontinued in favor of Chromecast with Google TV

name: Google Listen
description: Google Listen was an Android application that let you search, subscribe, download, and stream podcasts and web audio.
shutdownReasonDetail: Podcast app discontinued as Google shifted podcast focus to Google Play Music and later YouTube Music

name: Google Directory
description: Google Directory was an Internet website directory organized into 14 main categories that allowed users to explore the web.
shutdownReasonDetail: Web directory service shut down as algorithmic search made human-curated directories obsolete

name: Gears
description: Gears (aka Google Gears) was utility software that aimed to create more powerful web apps by adding offline storage and other additional features to web browsers.
shutdownReasonDetail: Browser extension enabling offline web apps made obsolete by HTML5 and modern web standards

name: Building Maker
description: Building Maker enabled users to create 3D models of buildings for Google Earth on the browser.
shutdownReasonDetail: 3D modeling tool for Google Earth shut down as Google Earth evolved and professional tools dominated

name: Google Dictionary
description: Google Dictionary was a standalone online dictionary service.
shutdownReasonDetail: Chrome extension providing word definitions discontinued as Chrome added native definition lookup

name: Google Friend Connect
description: Google Friend Connect was a free social networking site from 2008 to 2012.
shutdownReasonDetail: Social widget allowing website visitors to connect shut down due to privacy concerns and low adoption

name: Glass OS
description: Glass OS (Google XE) was a version of Google's Android operating system designed for Google Glass.
shutdownReasonDetail: Operating system for Google Glass discontinued when consumer Glass project was shut down

name: Tez
description: Tez was a mobile payments service by Google, targeted at users in India. It was rebranded to Google Pay.
shutdownReasonDetail: Mobile payment app in India rebranded to Google Pay, original Tez brand discontinued

name: Google Offers
description: Google Offers was a service offering discounts and coupons. Initially, it was a deal of the day website similar to Groupon.
shutdownReasonDetail: Daily deals service shut down after failing to compete against Groupon and LivingSocial

name: MyTracks
description: MyTracks was a GPS tracking application for Android which allowed users to track their path, speed, distance, and elevation.
shutdownReasonDetail: GPS tracking app for recording athletic activities discontinued as Google shifted focus away from fitness apps

name: Pie
description: Pie was a work-centric group chat website and app comparable to Slack.
shutdownReasonDetail: Smart display device concept discontinued after failing to gain developer and manufacturer support

name: Google Portfolios
description: Portfolios was a feature available in Google Finance to track personal financial securities.
shutdownReasonDetail: Stock portfolio tracking tool discontinued due to low user engagement and market competition

name: Google Site Search
description: Google's Site Search was a service that enabled any website to add a custom search field powered by Google.
shutdownReasonDetail: Custom search engine for websites shut down as Google shifted to standard search integration

name: Google Currents
description: Google Currents was a social magazine app by Google, which was replaced by Google Play Newsstand.
shutdownReasonDetail: Magazine-style news reader discontinued in favor of Google Play Newsstand and later Google News

name: BumpTop
description: BumpTop was a skeuomorphic desktop environment app that simulates the normal behavior and physical properties of a real-world desk and enhances it with automatic tools to organize its contents.
shutdownReasonDetail: 3D desktop interface acquired by Google and discontinued after brief experimentation

name: Google Checkout
description: Google Checkout was an online payment processing service that aimed to simplify the process of paying for online purchases.
shutdownReasonDetail: Payment processing service shut down as Google Wallet and later Google Pay became primary payment products

name: Google Pack
description: Google Pack was a collection of software tools offered by Google to download in a single archive. It was announced at the 2006 Consumer Electronics Show, on January 6. Google Pack was only available for Windows XP, Windows Vista, and Windows 7.
shutdownReasonDetail: Software bundle installer discontinued as software distribution moved to web-based and app store models

name: Timeful
description: Timeful was an iOS to-do list and calendar application, developed to reinvent the way that people manage their most precious resource of time.
shutdownReasonDetail: Calendar and scheduling app acquired by Google with features integrated into Google Calendar

name: Google Rebang
description: Rebang was a Zeitgeist-like service centered on providing service to a Chinese audience. It was incorporated into Google Labs as of late 2010, and later discontinued along with its parent project.
shutdownReasonDetail: Social search tool testing different result ranking approaches shut down after limited testing

name: Slide
description: Slide was a photo sharing software for social networking services such as MySpace and Facebook. Later Slide began to make applications and became the largest developer of third-party applications for Facebook.
shutdownReasonDetail: Social gaming platform acquired by Google and shut down as social gaming market shifted

name: Real Estate On Google Maps
description: Real Estate on Google Maps enabled users to find places for sale or rent in an area they were interested in.
shutdownReasonDetail: Real estate search feature in Google Maps consolidated into standard search results

name: Needlebase
description: Needlebase was a point-and-click tool for extracting, sorting and visualizing data from across pages around the web.
shutdownReasonDetail: Web scraping and data extraction tool acquired by Google and shut down after minimal integration

name: Google Cloud Connect
description: Google Cloud Connect was a free cloud computing plugin for multiple versions of Microsoft Office that automatically stored and synchronized files to Google Docs.
shutdownReasonDetail: Microsoft Office plugin for Google Docs integration discontinued as Office 365 cloud improved

name: Google SMS
description: Google SMS let you text questions- including weather, sports scores, word definitions, and more- to 466453 and get an answer back.
shutdownReasonDetail: Text messaging search interface discontinued as smartphones made SMS search less relevant

name: Google News & Weather
description: Google News & Weather was a news aggregator application available on the Android and iOS operating systems.
shutdownReasonDetail: Mobile weather app discontinued as weather information was integrated into Google Search and Assistant

name: Google Script Converter
description: Google Script Converter was an online transliteration tool for transliteration (script conversion) between Hindi, Romanagari, and various other scripts. It's ended because Google shut down Google Labs and all associated projects.
shutdownReasonDetail: Tool for converting Google Apps Scripts shut down as Apps Script platform matured

name: Google Video
description: Google Video was a free video hosting service from Google, similar to YouTube, that allowed video clips to be hosted on Google servers and embedded onto other websites.
shutdownReasonDetail: Video hosting service shut down as YouTube became Google's primary video platform

name: ZygoteBody
description: ZygoteBody, formerly Google Body, was a web application by Zygote Media Group that rendered manipulable 3D anatomical models of the human body.
shutdownReasonDetail: Interactive 3D human anatomy tool shut down after being donated to open source community

name: On2 Flix Cloud
description: Flix Cloud was a high-capacity online video encoding service.
shutdownReasonDetail: Cloud-based video encoding service shut down as Google Cloud Platform offered alternative solutions

name: Noop Programming Language
description: Noop was a project by Google engineers Alex Eagle and Christian Gruber aiming to develop a new programming language that attempted to blend the best features of 'old' and 'new' languages and best practices.
shutdownReasonDetail: Experimental programming language project discontinued after failing to gain developer adoption

name: Google Maps Engine
description: Google Maps Engine was an online tool for map creation. It enabled you to create layered maps using your data as well as Google Maps data.
shutdownReasonDetail: Map creation and data visualization tool shut down as Google shifted to Google My Maps

name: Save to Google Chrome Extension
description: Save to Google Chrome Extension enabled you to quickly save a page link with image and tags to a Pocket-like app.
shutdownReasonDetail: Chrome extension for saving content discontinued as native Chrome bookmark and reading list improved

name: Google Flu Vaccine Finder
description: Google Flu Vaccine Finder was a maps mash-up that showed nearby vaccination places across the United States.
shutdownReasonDetail: Tool for finding flu vaccine locations discontinued as Google integrated health information into Search

name: Google One Pass
description: Google One Pass was an online store developed by Google for media publishers looking to sell subscriptions to their content.
shutdownReasonDetail: Digital content payment system shut down as Google Play became the primary payment platform

name: Google Image Swirl
description: Google Image Swirl was an enhancement to the image search tool that came out of Google Labs. It was built on top of image search by grouping images with similar visual and semantic qualities.
shutdownReasonDetail: Visual search interface grouping similar images shut down after testing period

name: Google Hands Free
description: Google Hands Free was a mobile payment system that allowed users to pay their bill using Bluetooth to connect to payment terminals by saying 'I'll pay with Google.'
shutdownReasonDetail: Tap-to-pay mobile payment service shut down after limited pilot testing

name: Freebase
description: Freebase was a large collaborative knowledge base consisting of structured data composed mainly by its community members, developed by Metaweb(acquired by Google).
shutdownReasonDetail: Knowledge graph database shut down after being donated to open source community

name: Wildfire Interactive
description: Wildfire by Google was a social marketing application that enabled businesses to create, optimize and measure their presence on social networks.
shutdownReasonDetail: Social media marketing platform acquired and shut down as Google exited social advertising tools

name: Google Now
description: Google Now was a feature of Google Search that offered predictive cards with information and daily updates in Chrome and the Google app for Android and iOS.
shutdownReasonDetail: Predictive information cards in Android discontinued as Google Assistant became the primary interface

name: Google Flu Trends
description: Google Flu Trends was a service attempting to make accurate predictions about flu activity.
shutdownReasonDetail: Disease surveillance tool shut down after research found prediction accuracy issues

name: Google Insights for Search
description: Google Insights for Search was a service used to provide data about terms people searched in Google and was merged into Google Trends.
shutdownReasonDetail: Keyword research tool merged into Google Trends as standalone interface became redundant

name: Send to Phone
description: Google Send to Phone was an add-on to send links and other information from Firefox to their phone by text message.
shutdownReasonDetail: Chrome extension for sending tabs to phone discontinued as Chrome's native sync improved

name: Urchin
description: Urchin was a web statistics analysis program developed by Urchin Software Corporation. It analyzed web server log file content and displayed the traffic information on that website based upon the log data.
shutdownReasonDetail: Web analytics platform acquired by Google that became foundation for Google Analytics

name: Chromebook Pixel
description: Chromebook Pixel was a first-of-its-kind laptop built by Google that ran Chrome OS, a Linux kernel-based operating system.
shutdownReasonDetail: High-end laptop discontinued due to poor sales and shift to more affordable Chromebook models

name: Google Video Player
description: The Google Video Player plays back files in Google's own Google Video File (.gvi) media format and supported playlists in 'Google Video Pointer' (.gvp) format.
shutdownReasonDetail: Desktop application for playing Google Video files discontinued as web-based video playback improved

name: qpx-express-API
description: A service that Google developed for long-tail travel clients. ITA Software will create a new, easier way for users to find better flight information online, which should encourage more users to make their flight purchases online.
shutdownReasonDetail: Flight booking API shut down as Google reduced support for external travel booking integrations

name: Songza
description: Songza was a free music streaming service that would recommend its users' various playlists based on time of day and mood or activity.
shutdownReasonDetail: Music streaming service acquired by Google and shut down after integration into Google Play Music

name: Google Chrome Frame
description: Google Chrome Frame was a plugin for Internet Explorer that allowed web pages to be displayed using WebKit and the V8 JavaScript engine.
shutdownReasonDetail: Browser plugin enabling modern features in IE discontinued as Internet Explorer usage declined

name: Apture
description: Apture was a service that allowed publishers and bloggers to link and incorporate multimedia into a dynamic layer above their pages.
shutdownReasonDetail: Annotation and knowledge service for web content shut down after acquisition by Google

name: fflick
description: fflick was a review, information, and news website that used information from aggregated Tweets to rate movies as positive or negative.
shutdownReasonDetail: Movie recommendation service shut down after acquisition by Google with minimal integration

name: Google TV
description: Google TV was a smart TV platform that integrated Android and Chrome to create an interactive television overlay.
shutdownReasonDetail: Smart TV platform shut down as Android TV became Google's unified TV operating system

name: Google Refine
description: Google Refine was a standalone desktop application for data cleanup and transformation to other formats.
shutdownReasonDetail: Data cleaning and transformation tool donated to open source as OpenRefine after Google discontinued it

name: Google Fusion Tables
description: Google Fusion Tables was a web service for data management that provided a means for visualizing data in different charts, maps, and graphs.
shutdownReasonDetail: Tool for visualizing and analyzing data shut down as Google Sheets and Data Studio provided alternatives

name: Google Web APIs
description: The Google Web APIs were a free SOAP service for doing Google searches so that developers could use the results in almost any way they wanted.
shutdownReasonDetail: SOAP API for Google Search shut down as REST APIs and web interfaces became standard

name: Google Sets
description: Google Sets generates a list of items when users enter a few examples. For example, entering "Green, Purple, Red" emits the list "Green, Purple, Red, Blue, Black, White, Yellow, Orange, Brown".
shutdownReasonDetail: Web-based tool for finding related content shut down as Google integrated similar features into Search

name: Android @ Home
description: Android @ Home allowed a user’s device to discover, connect, and communicate with devices and appliances in the home.
shutdownReasonDetail: Smart home automation platform announced but never launched as Google shifted to Matter standard

name: Pixate
description: Pixate was a platform for creating sophisticated animations and interactions, and refining your designs through 100% native prototypes for iOS and Android.
shutdownReasonDetail: Design and prototyping tool acquired by Google and shut down after features moved to other products

name: Google Earth Browser Plug-in
description: Google Earth Browser Plug-in allowed developers to embed Google Earth into web pages and included a JavaScript API for custom 3D drawing and interaction.
shutdownReasonDetail: Browser plugin for viewing Google Earth content discontinued as web-based Google Earth improved

name: Google Toolbar for Firefox
description: Google Toolbar for Firefox
shutdownReasonDetail: Firefox toolbar discontinued as Firefox's native features and Chrome gained market share

name: Google Notification Widget (Mr. Jingles)
description: Mr. Jingles (aka Google Notification Widget) displayed alerts and notifications from across multiple Google services.
shutdownReasonDetail: Widget for displaying Google notifications discontinued due to low adoption and notification improvements

name: YouTube Video Annotations
description: YouTube Video Annotations allowed video creators to add interactive commentary to their videos containing background information, branching ("choose your own adventure" style) stories, or links to any YouTube video, channel, or search results page.
shutdownReasonDetail: End screen cards and annotations in YouTube videos removed in favor of cards and end screens

name: Google Nearby Notifications
description: Google Nearby Notifications were a proximity marketing tool using Bluetooth beacons and location-based data to serve content relevant to an Android user's real-world location.
shutdownReasonDetail: Proximity-based notification system shut down due to privacy concerns and user complaints about spam

name: Google Audio Ads
description: Google Audio Ads service allowed advertisers to run campaigns on AM/FM radio stations in the US using the AdWords interface.
shutdownReasonDetail: Advertising service for radio broadcasts discontinued as Google exited traditional media advertising

name: Word Lens
description: Word Lens translated text in real time on images by using the viewfinder of a device's camera without the need of an internet connection; The technology was rolled into Google Translate.
shutdownReasonDetail: Augmented reality translation app acquired by Google and integrated into Google Translate

name: Google Cloud Messaging (GCM)
description: Google Cloud Messaging (GCM) was a notification service that enabled developers to send messages between servers and client apps running on Android or Chrome.
shutdownReasonDetail: Mobile notification service for Android replaced by Firebase Cloud Messaging

name: Google Realtime API
description: Google Realtime API provided ways to synchronize resources between devices. It operated on files stored on Google Drive.
shutdownReasonDetail: Chrome API for real-time data synchronization shut down as WebSockets and other standards emerged

name: Data Saver Extension for Chrome
description: Data Saver was an extension for Chrome that routed web pages through Google servers to compress and reduce the user's bandwidth.
shutdownReasonDetail: Chrome extension for data compression discontinued as mobile data became more affordable

name: Google Trader
description: Google Trader was a classifieds service run by Google in Ghana, Uganda, Kenya, and Nigeria to help customers trade goods and services online.
shutdownReasonDetail: Product search and comparison tool discontinued as Google Shopping provided better shopping experience

name: Works with Nest API
description: Works with Nest was an API that allowed external services to access and control Nest devices. This enabled the devices to be used with third-party home automation platforms and devices.
shutdownReasonDetail: API for Nest device integrations shut down as Google transitioned to new smart home platform

name: Google Jump
description: Google Jump was a cloud-based VR media solution that enabled 3D-360 media production by integrating customized capture solutions with best-in-class automated stitching.
shutdownReasonDetail: VR camera rig and video platform shut down as consumer VR market failed to take off

name: reCAPTCHA Mailhide
description: reCAPTCHA Mailhide allowed users to mask their email address behind a captcha to prevent robots from scraping the email and sending spam.
shutdownReasonDetail: Email obfuscation service for reCAPTCHA users discontinued due to low usage and spam evolution

name: YouTube Gaming
description: YouTube Gaming was a video gaming-oriented service and app for videos and live streaming.
shutdownReasonDetail: Gaming-focused YouTube interface shut down as gaming content was integrated into main YouTube

name: Google Trips
description: Google Trips was a mobile app that allowed users to plan for upcoming travel by facilitating flight, hotel, car, and restaurant reservations from user's email alongside summarized info about the user's destination.
shutdownReasonDetail: Travel planning app discontinued as Google integrated travel features into Search and Maps

name: Areo
description: Areo was a mobile app that allowed users in Bangalore, Mumbai, Delhi, Gurgaon, and Pune to order meals from nearby restaurants or schedule appointments with local service professionals, including electricians, painters, cleaners, plumbers, and more.
shutdownReasonDetail: Food and grocery delivery service in India shut down after failing to compete with established players

name: Hangouts on Air
description: Hangouts on Air allowed users to host a multi-user video call while recording and streaming the call on YouTube.
shutdownReasonDetail: Live video streaming feature in Hangouts discontinued as YouTube Live became the primary platform

name: Google Translator Toolkit
description: Google Translator Toolkit was a web application which allowed translators to edit and manage translations generated by Google Translate.
shutdownReasonDetail: Web-based translation memory tool shut down as Google Translate API improved

name: G Suite Training
description: G Suite Training (previously known as Synergyse) provided interactive and video-based training for 20 Google G Suite products in nine languages through a website and a Chrome extension.
shutdownReasonDetail: Online learning platform for G Suite discontinued as training was integrated into product help

name: uWeave
description: uWeave (pronounced “micro weave”) was an implementation of the Weave protocol intended for use on microcontroller-based devices.
shutdownReasonDetail: Enterprise social collaboration tool shut down after failing to gain traction in corporate market

name: Google Wallet Card
description: Google Wallet Card was a prepaid debit card that let users pay for things in person and online using their Wallet balance at any retailer that accepted MasterCard.
shutdownReasonDetail: Physical debit card for Google Wallet discontinued as mobile payments became primary method

name: AngularJS
description: AngularJS was a JavaScript open-source front-end web framework based on MVC pattern using a dependency injection technique.
shutdownReasonDetail: JavaScript framework superseded by Angular (version 2+) as Google rebuilt the framework

name: Field Trip
description: Field Trip was a mobile app that acted as a virtual tour guide by cross-referencing multiple sources of information to provide users information about points of interest near them.
shutdownReasonDetail: Location-based discovery app discontinued as Google Maps integrated similar features

name: Focals by North
description: Focals were a custom-built smart glasses product with a transparent, holographic display that allowed users to read and respond to text messages, navigate turn-by-turn directions, check the weather, and integrate with third-party services like Uber and Amazon Alexa.
shutdownReasonDetail: Smart glasses acquired from North shut down as Google shifted AR focus to software

name: Dragonfly
description: Dragonfly was a search engine designed to be compatible with China's state censorship provisions.
shutdownReasonDetail: Censored search engine project for China canceled after internal protests and ethical concerns

name: Google Related
description: Google Related was introduced to be an experimental navigation assistant launched to help people find useful and interesting information while surfing the web.
shutdownReasonDetail: Chrome extension showing related content shut down as Google refined search result recommendations

name: Google Fiber TV
description: Google Fiber TV was an IPTV service that was bundled with Google Fiber.
shutdownReasonDetail: Cable TV service discontinued as Google Fiber focused on internet service only

name: Message Center
description: Message Center was a web console where Gmail users could view and manage spam email messages.
shutdownReasonDetail: Communication tool for Google+/YouTube shut down when Google+ was discontinued

name: Google Play Newsstand
description: Google Play Newsstand was a news aggregator and digital newsstand service.
shutdownReasonDetail: Magazine and news reading app discontinued as Google News became the primary news product

name: Together
description: Together was a watch face for Android Wear that let two users link their watches together to share small visual messages.
shutdownReasonDetail: Video collaboration tool for remote teams shut down after failing to gain adoption

name: Punchd
description: Punchd was a digital loyalty card app and service targeted towards small businesses that originated as a student project at Cal Poly in 2009 and was acquired by Google in 2011.
shutdownReasonDetail: Loyalty card tracking service acquired and shut down after integration into Google Wallet

name: Androidify
description: Androidify allowed users to create a custom Android avatar for themselves and others.
shutdownReasonDetail: App for creating Android avatar stickers discontinued as similar features moved to other apps

name: Trusted Contacts
description: Trusted Contacts was an app that allowed users to share their location and view the location of specific users.
shutdownReasonDetail: Emergency contact sharing app shut down as Android integrated similar SOS features natively

name: Gesture Search
description: Google Gesture Search allowed users to search contacts, applications, settings, music, and bookmark on their Android device by drawing letters or numbers onto the screen.
shutdownReasonDetail: Gesture-based Android search tool discontinued as voice search became dominant input method

name: Nest Secure
description: Nest Secure was a security system with an alarm, keypad, and motion sensor with an embedded microphone.
shutdownReasonDetail: Home security system discontinued as Google consolidated Nest product line and exited security market

name: Expeditions
description: Expeditions was a program for providing virtual reality experiences to school classrooms through Google Cardboard viewers, allowing educators to take their students on virtual field trips.
shutdownReasonDetail: VR field trip application for education shut down as Google pivoted away from consumer VR

name: Science Journal
description: Science Journal was a mobile app that helped you run science experiments with your smartphone using the device's onboard sensors.
shutdownReasonDetail: Science experimentation app for students discontinued as Google shifted education focus

name: Tour Creator
description: Tour Creator allowed users to build immersive, 360° guided tours that could be viewed with VR devices.
shutdownReasonDetail: VR tour creation tool shut down as Google wound down consumer VR initiatives

name: Game Builder
description: Game Builder was a multiplayer 3D game environment for creating new games without coding experience.
shutdownReasonDetail: Game creation tool for building 3D games shut down as Google exited consumer game development

name: Poly
description: Poly was a distribution platform for creators to share 3D objects.
shutdownReasonDetail: 3D model sharing platform shut down as Google consolidated VR/AR efforts

name: Google Home Max
description: Google Home Max was a large, stereo smart speaker with two tweeters and subwoofers, aux input, and a USB-C input (for wired ethernet) featuring Smart Sound machine learning technology.
shutdownReasonDetail: High-end smart speaker discontinued due to poor sales and competition from lower-priced alternatives

name: Timely
description: Timely Alarm Clock was an Android application providing an alarm, stopwatch, and timer functionality with synchronization across devices.
shutdownReasonDetail: Alarm clock app acquired by Google and shut down after features integrated into Android Clock

name: Loon
description: Loon was a service to provide internet access via an array of high-altitude balloons hovering in the Earth's stratosphere
shutdownReasonDetail: Internet balloon project shut down after failing to achieve commercial viability

name: Swift for TensorFlow
description: Swift for TensorFlow (S4TF) was a next-generation platform for machine learning with a focus on differentiable programming.
shutdownReasonDetail: Programming language for machine learning discontinued as Python became the standard for TensorFlow

name: Google Bookmarks
description: Google Bookmarks was a private web-based bookmarking service not integrated with any other Google services.
shutdownReasonDetail: Web-based bookmark manager largely abandoned as Chrome's native bookmarks improved

name: Material Gallery
description: Material Gallery was a collaboration tool for UI designers, optimized for Google's Material Design, with mobile preview apps and a Sketch plugin.
shutdownReasonDetail: Design resource sharing tool shut down as Material Design guidance moved to dedicated site

name: G Suite (Legacy Free Edition)
description: G Suite (Legacy Free Edition) was a free tier offering some of the services included in Google's productivity suite.
shutdownReasonDetail: Free version of G Suite discontinued as Google pushed users to paid Workspace plans

name: Backup and Sync
description: Backup and Sync was a desktop software tool for Windows and macOS that allowed users to sync files from Google Drive to their local machine.
shutdownReasonDetail: Desktop backup application replaced by Google Drive desktop app with unified sync

name: Streams
description: Streams was a "clinician support app" which aimed to improve clinical decision-making and patient safety across hospitals in the United Kingdom.
shutdownReasonDetail: Healthcare data analysis platform shut down due to privacy concerns and limited hospital adoption

name: YouTube Originals
description: YouTube Originals was a variety of original content including scripted series, educational videos, and music and celebrity programming.
shutdownReasonDetail: Premium scripted content service shut down as YouTube focused on creator-generated content

name: Your News Update
description: Your News Update was a service that offered an audio digest of a mix of short news stories chosen at that moment based on a user's interests, location, user history, and preferences, as well as the top news stories out there.
shutdownReasonDetail: Podcast-style news briefing shut down as Google Assistant's news features evolved

name: Google Pinyin IME
description: Google Pinyin IME was an input method that allowed users on multiple operating systems to input characters from pinyin, the romanization of Standard Mandarin Chinese.
shutdownReasonDetail: Chinese input method editor for Windows discontinued as Google exited China market

name: VR180 Creator
description: VR180 Creator allowed users to edit video taken on 180-degree and 360-degree devices on multiple operating systems.
shutdownReasonDetail: VR video editing tool discontinued as Google wound down consumer VR content creation initiatives

name: Google Sites (Classic)
description: Google Sites (Classic) allowed users to build and edit websites and wiki portals for private and public use.
shutdownReasonDetail: Classic version of Google Sites shut down as new Google Sites replaced it

name: Playground AR
description: Playground AR (aka AR Stickers) allowed users to place virtual characters and objects in augmented reality via the Camera App on Pixel phones.
shutdownReasonDetail: Augmented reality sticker app discontinued as AR features were integrated into Google Camera

name: Personal Blocklist
description: Personal Blocklist was a Chrome Web Extension by Google that allowed users to block certain websites from appearing in Google search results.
shutdownReasonDetail: Chrome extension for blocking websites discontinued as Chrome added native site blocking

name: AdSense (mobile app)
description: AdSense (mobile app) allowed users to manage their AdSense accounts in a native app for iOS and Android.
shutdownReasonDetail: Mobile app for AdSense shut down as mobile web interface provided sufficient functionality

name: YouTube for PS Vita
description: YouTube for PlayStation Vita was a native YouTube browsing and viewing application for the PS Vita and PSTV game consoles.
shutdownReasonDetail: YouTube app for PlayStation Vita discontinued as platform lost support

name: Posts on Google
description: Posts on Google allowed notable individuals with knowledge graph panels to author specific content that would appear in Google Search results.
shutdownReasonDetail: Feature allowing businesses to post updates in Search shut down due to low engagement

name: YouTube Community Contributions
description: YouTube Community Contributions allowed users to contribute translations for video titles or submit descriptions, closed captions or subtitles on YouTube content.
shutdownReasonDetail: Crowdsourced subtitle and translation feature shut down due to quality and spam issues

name: Google Currents (2019)
description: Google Currents was a service that provided social media features similar to Google+ for Google Workspace customers.
shutdownReasonDetail: Enterprise social network replacing Google+ shut down after failing to gain traction

name: Google Assistant Snapshot
description: Google Assistant Snapshot was the successor to Google Now that provided predictive cards with information and daily updates in the Google app for Android and iOS.
shutdownReasonDetail: Personalized feed feature in Google Assistant discontinued as Google refined Assistant interface

name: Google Cloud Prediction API
description: Google Cloud Prediction API was a PaaS for machine learning (ML) functionality to help developers build ML models to create application features such as recommendation systems, spam detection, and purchase prediction.
shutdownReasonDetail: Machine learning prediction API shut down as Google Cloud AI Platform provided superior alternatives

name: Conversational Actions
description: Conversational Actions extended the functionality of Google Assistant by allowing 3rd party developers to create custom experiences, or conversations, for users of Google Assistant.
shutdownReasonDetail: Google Assistant conversation features shut down as Google shifted to app-based Actions

name: Kormo Jobs
description: Kormo Jobs was an app that allowed users in primarily India, Indonesia, and Bangladesh to help them find jobs nearby that match their skills and interests.
shutdownReasonDetail: Job search app in India shut down after failing to compete with established job platforms

name: Google Hangouts
description: Google Hangouts was a cross-platform instant messaging service.
shutdownReasonDetail: Messaging app shut down as Google consolidated to Google Chat for workspace and Messages for SMS

name: Google Cloud IoT Core
description: Google Cloud IoT Core was a managed service designed to let customers securely connect, manage, and ingest data from globally dispersed devices.
shutdownReasonDetail: IoT device management service shut down due to low adoption and shift to Matter standard

name: Threadit
description: Threadit was a tool for recording and sharing short videos.
shutdownReasonDetail: Discussion platform for Google Drive shut down after minimal adoption

name: Duplex on the Web
description: Duplex on the Web was a Google Assistant technology that automated tasks on the web on behalf of a user; such as booking movie tickets or making restaurant reservations.
shutdownReasonDetail: Web automation service using Google Assistant shut down after limited rollout and technical challenges

name: Polymer
description: Polymer was an open-source JS library for web components
shutdownReasonDetail: Web components library largely deprecated as modern frameworks and web standards evolved

name: Build with Chrome
description: Build with Chrome was a collaboration between Chrome and the LEGO Group that allowed users to build and publish LEGO creations to any digital plot of land in the world through Google Maps.
shutdownReasonDetail: LEGO collaboration for building in Chrome shut down as plugin support and interest declined

name: Google Street View (standalone app)
description: Google Street View app was an Android and iOS app that enabled people to get a 360 degree view of locations around the world.
shutdownReasonDetail: Standalone mobile app for Street View shut down as Street View was fully integrated into Maps app

name: Google Optimize
description: Google Optimize was a web analytics and testing tool that allowed users to run experiments aimed at increasing visitor conversion rates and overall satisfaction.
shutdownReasonDetail: A/B testing and personalization platform shut down as Google Cloud offered alternative solutions

name: Grasshopper
description: Grasshopper was a free mobile and web app for aspiring programmers that taught introductory JavaScript and coding fundamentals using fun, bite-sized puzzles.
shutdownReasonDetail: Coding education app shut down after acquisition by Area 120

name: Pixel Pass
description: Pixel Pass was a program that allowed users to pay a monthly charge for their Pixel phone and upgrade immediately after two years.
shutdownReasonDetail: Subscription bundle for Pixel phones shut down due to low uptake and complex value proposition

name: Google Podcasts
description: Google Podcasts was a podcast hosting platform and an Android podcast listening app.
shutdownReasonDetail: Podcast app shut down as YouTube Music became Google's unified audio platform

name: Jamboard
description: Jamboard was a digital 4K touchscreen whiteboard device that allowed to collaborate using Google Workspace services.
shutdownReasonDetail: Digital whiteboard hardware discontinued due to poor sales and shift to remote work software

name: Google Jamboard
description: Google Jamboard was a web and native whiteboard app that offered a rich collaborative experience.
shutdownReasonDetail: Digital whiteboard product discontinued (duplicate entry) due to poor sales in hybrid work era

name: Google Cache
description: Google Cache was a tool to view cached/older versions of a website. It was one of the oldest products.
shutdownReasonDetail: Cached page snapshots removed from search results as live pages and Wayback Machine were preferred

name: Keen
description: Keen was a Pinterest-style platform with ML recommendations.
shutdownReasonDetail: Interest-based content curation app shut down after failing to gain users

name: Tables by A120
description: Tables was a collaborative database platform and competitor to Airtable, focused on making project tracking more efficient with automation.
shutdownReasonDetail: Collaborative project management tool shut down after failing to compete with Airtable and Notion
